edu.cooper

Class Agent

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cooper.Agent

  • public class Agent
extends java.lang.Object
    An agent can choose which route to travel along, either randomly or by making use of the Traffic Route Preference Function.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • Agent

        public Agent(int ID,
     int num_routes,
     int[] thresholds,
     double[] weights,
     double fracChange,
     double fracTRPF)
        Parameters:
        ID - A unique ID for this agent. Currently unused.
        num_routes - The total number of available routes in this simulation.
        thresholds - A list containing a threshold for each route. When the number of drivers on the current route is greater than the System Optimum by this threshold, then the agent will (probably) report congestion. I say probably because some agents do not report congestion based on the fracTRPF parameter ('p' in the .properties file).
        weights - A list containing a weight for each route. When the number of drivers on the current route is greater than the System Optimum by the associated threshold, then the agent will (probably) report congestion. I say probably because some agents do not report congestion based on the parameter fracTRPF parameter ('p' in the .properties file).
        fracChange - Each time the agent needs to choose a route, it first chooses a random number. If the number is less than fracChange, then the agent will choose a new route. Othrwise, it will stay on the same route.
        fracTRPF - During initialization, the agent chooses a random number. If the number is less than fracTRPF, then the agent will report congestion and use the TRPF when making route choices. Otherwise it will not report congestion and will choose a route randomly.

    • Method Detail

      • chooseRoute

        public int chooseRoute()
        Choose randomly from one of the routes in routelist
        Returns:
        An int from 0 to number_routes representing the chosen route.

      • chooseRoute

        public int chooseRoute(double[] trpf)
        The agent chooses a new route based on the following process.
        • First, the agent decides whether it will choose a new route or just stick with the old one by choosing a random number between 0 and 1 and seeing whether it is less than fracChange ('G' in the .properties file).
        • If it does not change routes, it just returns the previously selected route.
        • If it does change routes, and it's an agent who uses the TRPF, then it will select the route with highest scoring TRPF (breaking ties randomly).
        • If it does change routes, but does not use the TRPF, then it will choose a new route randomly.
        Parameters:
        trpf - A list containing the Traffic Route Preference Function for each of the possible routes.
        Returns:
        The chosen route (expressed as an integer between 0 and numroutes).

      • getPrevRouteChoice

        public int getPrevRouteChoice()
        Returns the previously made routechoice
        Returns:
        The previously made routechoice.

      • usesTRPF

        public boolean usesTRPF()
        Returns whether this agent is among those who use the TRPF. When iniitialized, the agent decides whether to use the TRPF by choosing a random number and seeing whether it is less than fracTRPF ('p' in the .properties file).
        Returns:

      • congestionReport

        public double congestionReport(int numCarsOverSO)
        Returns the congestion level of the current route. When the number of drivers on the current route is greater than the System Optimum by the largest threshold, then the agent will report congestion. For example, if the thresholds specified in the .properties file are
        w = 10:3, 20:5
        then the agent will report "3" if there are 10 more drivers on this route than the System Optimum. If there are at least 20 more drivers on this route than the System Optimum, then the agent will report 5
        * Note that the agent will only report congestion if it uses the TRPF.
        Parameters:
        numCarsOverSO - The difference between the number of drivers on this route and the number of drivers there should be on this route at the System Optimum.
        Returns:
        Returns a weight expressing the level of congestion on the road.
